If "positive" change is to happen, we must believe in what our founding fathers wanted and laid out in the Constitution.
 
 The bottom line is the "dollar" and our dollar is very weak, and on the verge of implosion. Our own government throws billions into the stock market to "prop" it up to save face, we have a foreclosure crisis on the horizon and the less buying power, and that is just the tip of iceberg. We are heading for a financial train wreck, and the only one that wants to talk about real economics is Ron Paul.
 
 We need to stop the great divide of poor and rich and wiping out the middle class. 
 
 Vote for common sense, vote to restore our founding ancestors heritage. Vote Ron Paul.
 
 Up until October, I've always been "non-affliated", belonging to no political party. But for once, I signed up "republican" to vote for a great American, that we all can trust and believe in. 
 
 I know most will not vote for Ron Paul, but he has a lot to offer. I know he can offer the most beneficial change.
 
 Go to his web site and read his "writings" under the "learn" section. Read about Dr. Paul. Learn about the core issue of America, and that issue is staying strong as Americans; fiscally and in patriotism.
 
 -Cindy-
